Reviews.Title: An interesting camera.  I like it.
Reviews.Author: Eric L. Fox "vaporlock9"
Reviews.Content: A tiny little brick of a camera.  I took a few shots with it in my dim living room and compared them with both the Canon A620 and the Canon Rebel XTI...all in "auto".  The 520 HS took noisier pictures, yet they were much better to view than the others, which were less noisy but much darker.  Which is better, a black frame or a noisy picture?  I switched to Program mode and started playing with the settings and menus.  The first thing I noticed was that JPG compression was set at "fine"...not "very fine" which is an option. File size went up, but noise decreased quite a bit.  Much of the noise was in fact jpg compression artifacts.The IS seems to work quite well.The zoom is fantastic for a camera of this size.The lens is not "flat"...you can achieve quite nice bokeh for a point and shoot.It has user defined white balance, which I believe is one of the most important features to getting good photos.The super slow motion is cool, but kind of a gimmick.  I got some great video of hummingbirds around the feeder, but it is low resolution.There is no printed manual, just a PDF file on the included CD ROM.Flash is unobtrusive, but semi-weak.Overall, I'm quite happy with my purchase.  I think you'll get way better pictures than most point-and-shoots if you switch to the "Program" mode.  Your best camera is the one that you actually use to take pictures.  The availability of an inexpensive Ikelite underwater housing and the camera's ability to take HD video mean that the Canon Elph 520 HS is going on vacation with us, while the Canon DSLR is sitting at home.  My Canon A620 took fantastic underwater video and stills, but alas, after many scuba trips and several dozens of hours underwater (and many years) it doesn't like humidity any more.I'd give this 5 stars based on what it is and what it's intended to be used for, but in the end I rated it 4 stars because it is a bit noisy in "auto" mode.  I'll update this review after we get back from vacation where I'll really get to test the underwater mode and low light performance of stills and video.Update June 10th -The more I shoot with this camera the more I like it.  It is able to capture fantastic images in natural lighting with true to life colors. The myriad of scene modes makes getting the right shot on the first try very easy.  I really wouldn't call this a point and shoot...the images in auto mode are good, but when you switch into scene mode you can get fantastic images if you select the appropriate scene.  I'm upping my rating to 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: I love this little camera!
Reviews.Author: Ron
Reviews.Content: I received the 520HS on Saturday.  I am coming from the Canon SD1000, so I loved the fact that the 520HS is the same size, but 3/4 of an ounce lighter.  You can read about the features on Canon's website.  I really want to comment on the face recognition feature.  I took some photos on my computer to set up the face recognition.  Today, I took pictures of my daughter's three month old twin girls.  I was amazed that the camera recognized their faces.  The camera did not use flash even though we were indoors.  I must say the pictures are truly amazing.  They look like a professional photographer took them.  I have read some negative reviews that claim the camera gives poor low light pictures.  Some reviewers did not even have a micro SD card in the camera.  Well, that is not the case.  The DIGIC 5 processor is exceptional for indoor shooting without a flash.  The reviewers complained that they already had SD cards and did not like the fact that they would have to get a Micro SD card.  I got an 8GB, Class 10, micro SD with the Amazon name for $11.99.  I can't comment on the battery life yet because I have not had to recharge it.  I didn't get the 530HS because I had heard negative feedback about the touch screen.  The only thing other than the touch screen that is different is that the 530HS has wi-fi.  The 520HS cost at least $50 less.  I am leaving on a cruise and will report back when I return.

Reviews.Title: The Reason For Mixed Reviews -- Revealed!
Reviews.Author: Mel R. Scurbica
Reviews.Content: I ust bought this camera for my wife, who is a technophobe. She loves it. The camera is simple to use on automatic mode...it really does everything for you.Now, why are there some negative reviews for this camera slamming it for image quality?Out of the box, the Canon PowerShot ELPH 520 HS is not configured at its highest-possible resolution. I don't know whether to blame lazy owners who don't take the time to go through the manual, novice owners who just don't understand, or Canon for making a bad decision for not making the default the highest resolution and for including the owner's manual on a CD where most people will never see it.So, here's what you do:Go into the camera's menu. Look for Image Quality and change the resolution from Fine to Super Fine.Now you own a tiny camera that takes great photos that Amazon sells for the same price brand new as Canon sells for a refurb. New, Canon sells this camera for over $130 more than Amazon.People who complain that image quality suffers in low light at high ISOs, I have news for you: Expensive digital cameras that cost $500 and up have the same problem. You could get a Sony DSC-RX100 II for over $700, which does really well in low light, but this camera is aimed at a different user base.Looking at images at 100 percent magnification, I did notice noise. But for most people, this isn't going to be an issue. Keep in mind this is an inexpensive consumer camera, not a professional grade camera, and not a prosumer grade camera. If you are a professional photographer looking to make giant prints, you aren't using this Elph. This is a camera to keep in your pocket or purse, meant to take photos of your friends and family.If you are looking for a little point and shoot camera that takes great photos, is easy enough for just about anyone to use, and that sells at a price that won't break the bank, this is the camera for you.

Reviews.Title: Simply Amazing
Reviews.Author: Jerry P. Danzig
Reviews.Content: For some years, I have had a Canon Digital ELPH S100, with which I have been very pleased.But time marches on, and the 2MP resolution of that fine little point and shoot has long been left behind.  As I recall, the camera also offered only three or four times optical zoom, if I'm not mistaken.So when I saw that Canon was offering this ELPH 520 with 10MP and 12X optical zoom -- and Amazon was selling it for less than half the price I paid for the S100 back when -- I couldn't resist.Incredibly, this new model is even more compact -- both thinner and lighter -- than the S100.  As other reviewers have stated, I don't know how Canon gets a 12X zoom into this little body, but they did.  Needless to say, this gives you much more flexibility framing shots from one vantage point.I didn't know if I would miss the optical viewfinder of the old model, but the 520 has a large (3-inch), bright LCD screen, and I just went out and shot some beautifully composed pictures of nearby architectural landmarks here in the Gramercy Park area of Manhattan.  As someone wearing both glasses and a brimmed hat on a cold day, I appreciated being able to compose pictures despite those encumbrances.I have barely begun to delve into the wealth of features this mighty mite of a camera offers, including HD video capture with stereo microphones, plus a long array of shooting modes to handle particular situations and subjects, including fireworks, portraits, low light, under water, snowy backgrounds, and more.The camera also offers some artistic special effects like vivid color, posterized shots, fish-eye lens, monochrome, plus the color accent so popular in advertising photography (one object in color -- the rest of the photo in monochrome).Best of all, you can set the camera to AUTO mode, and it will determine the best settings for any situation automatically.The camera comes with a USB cable to download photos to your computer, a proprietary battery and charger, wrist strap, plus photo software.  You will need to buy a MicroSD memory card; I thought I had one or more in the house, but found this card is smaller than the ones I had bought a few years back.I must also state that the red color of the camera body is MUCH more attractive than it appears in the photo on this page.  It is a beautiful red wine color, with an iridescent glow.  If you like gadgets in red, you will NOT be sorry buying the camera in this color, I assure you!I will report back if I encounter any drawbacks or problems.  (I saw one reviewer complaining about slow read/write to the memory card; after reading the camera instructions, I believe he needed to conduct a "low-level" formatting of his memory card, which is supposed to solve such a problem.)Until then, I am thrilled with this little gem and can't believe what a superb and convenient camera you can buy for the money...UPDATE: it was a beautiful, sunny, early spring day today, and I took a walking tour of lower Manhattan, bringing along this little Canon.  THIS MIGHTY MITE TAKES THE MOST INCREDIBLE PHOTOS!!!  EVERY single shot was perfectly exposed and in focus.In addition, I think there's something in this camera that even improves the photo composition.  The image stabilization works perfectly too, which is handy when you're zooming in on the top of a sixty-story building.Decades ago, I used a fine (and expensive) Nikkormat 35mm camera, and out of 100 photos there were sure to be a few clunkers.  I took 103 photos today, and every one was a winner!Trust me, folks, you will NOT be disappointed with this camera.  I only wonder why anyone would need anything larger or heavier to take great pictures; I don't think you do anymore.HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!

Reviews.Title: Steal of a deal!
Reviews.Author: Nikki
Reviews.Content: First and foremost I can tell you that I have been doing nothing but gushing over this camera since my husband and I bought it. For the price it is a perfect little point and shoot. And it literally is that. It took fantastic pictures right out of the box (well technically not, but I'll touch on that a little later). We didn't need to play with the settings or fuss with it in low light. The flash worked great and the face detection system is spot on. And I can't say enough about the optical zoom. There is not too many, if any, cameras out there at this price point with a 12x optical zoom. And it works great. You can zoom all the way to 12 and your shots still are sharp and crisp. Of coarse the digital zoom goes to 48x but you lose resolution the further you go. Now to touch on the out of box functionality. The one draw back with these cameras is no memory. And that is the case here. A couple shots is all you get unless you have a micro-sd ready to pop in. But those are quite inexpensive now and I popped an 8gb in and you can take over 3000 shots at full resolution. In closing, we loved this camera. We loved it so much we bought a second one so we can each have one. I got the cool blue colour though, red is his thing haha. But as DSLR users we totally appreciate the functionality of this little compact camera and fully endorse it. Happy shooting!

Reviews.Title: seems a winner
Reviews.Author: G. T. Spigel "shutterbug"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera a few weeks ago after having a canon powershot 710 is for 5 years. That camera had many attributes such as an optical viewfinder and AA batteries, but was only 6X optical zoom. I had tried other cameras over the last 1-2 years but the quality of the pictures was not good. This camera seems to be a winner. The pictures are nice and clear, the new cmos sensor works great in low light, it's very small so fits well in your shirt pocket, and it has 12X optical zoom. I'm not real enthused about the image browser software as the older canon zoom browser seemed easier to use but it's new for me. I had to by a micro SD card, there is no optical viewfinder, and it uses a rechargeable lithium battery, which seems to hold its charge well. It would be nice to have a printed manual rather than a CD for more in depth discussion of the camera but this is an industry trend. The movies are also quite good. I bought the camera at BJs where it was a little cheaper but had to buy the micro SD card which can be gotten cheaper online. All in all this camera seems like a winner and will update if my intial impression changes

Reviews.Title: Noisiest camera ever owned.
Reviews.Author: HCedrinks
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera to replace my aging Casio EX-Z1000, which has served me well over the past 5 years or so. I wanted something with a similar form factor, with the expectation that a newer camera would naturally include newer (and better) technology. The EX-Z1000 was great, but had problems with color accuracy and excess noise even at moderate ISO settings (ISO 400 and above).I've heard good things about Canon point-and-shoots for a while, so I figured I would go with one this time around. I settled on the Elph 520 HS, which at that time had the best reviews among its siblings (the 1xx and the 3xx series).I immediately tested the 520 HS upon getting it, shooting somewhere around 20 images before charging it and another 60-70 images after. The shots ranged from very-low-light situations (dark hallway in my apartment) to relatively bright outdoor shots (overcast day, parking lot on edge of forest).First the pros. The 12x zoom was nice. Color accuracy is better than my old camera. The settings only went down to ISO 100, but that's acceptable. I consider megapixel count to be irrelevant; anything above 8 MP is good enough in my book. The IS feature seemed to work well enough, but my hands are pretty stable so my opinion might not count in this matter.Now the cons. In a word: NOISE. On the camera's built-in screen, everything seemed fine at first sight. But zooming in, I began to notice the extreme amount of noise present in nearly all the pictures. Even at ISO 100, the noise was still painfully obvious -- and that's just on the camera's LCD screen. Viewing the pictures on my computer merely exacerbated the problem -- even monochromatic objects shot under good lighting conditions exhibited innumerable slightly off-color pixel bunches. Textured objects fared much worse, to the point of becoming blurry and riddled with what seemed to be noise removal artifacts. I had problems with noise on my EX-Z1000, but never to this extent; if I didn't know better I'd swear that the 520 HS is trying *too* hard to eliminate noise, which actually results in *more* noise. The noise issue was so bad it made the camera's other shortcomings (somewhat confused autofocus, relatively weak flash) seem insignificant. If you plan on printing out photos at the standard 4R size, then this might not be an issue. But if, like me, you like to set your photos as desktop wallpapers (or print them at larger sizes) then look elsewhere for your camera needs. As for me, I'm returning this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, big zoom
Reviews.Author: dclaar "dclaar"
Reviews.Content: I'm really happy with this camera. It takes great snapshots, and it is so small that I can always have it with me. Nobody will ever mistake it for a several thousand dollar DSLR, either in price, weight, or picture quality, but the 12x zoom in such a small package was the sweet spot for me. And lets face it, for most of us, being able to get the shot because you have your camera is much more important than the really high quality picture--that you're never going to blow up to room size anyway--that you would have got if only you hadn't left your big, heavy, awkward DSLR at home!Some folks have compared the quality to cell phones. There's no comparison. I can get shots that are just dark blobs on the iPhone. The battery is pretty small, though, so make sure you have two or three, which I have always done anyway (they're small, so it isn't that big a deal). Be careful if you buy an off brand battery: Many of them have LESS capacity. Don't go by the picture, many of them appear to be photoshopped to say 1000mAH, but the specs give you the real value. I picked up the Wasabi Power Battery for Canon NB-9L and Canon PowerShot SD4500 IS, ELPH 510 HS, ELPH 520 HS, ELPH 530 HS, and it seems OK so far, but I haven't rigorously tested it. The reviews were pretty good, though.

Reviews.Title: Cathy
Reviews.Author: CathyRod
Reviews.Content: I am a huge camera person.  I take pictures almost daily of something !!!  I had a Canon Sureshot and it finally died on me after many years of use.  I purchased this one and love it.  the pictures are clear, the color & clarity are really good.  It's small enough for a pocket / purse and very easy to use.  Defintely worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Great Pictures!
Reviews.Author: KatMom "KatMom"
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera.  It takes amazing pictures!  I bought it because of the price, the 12x zoom and the image stabilization.  It has exceeded my expectations.  I like the small size too.  I have to admit, I don't use many of the "bells and whistles" that come on most cameras these days so I can't really speak to how well they work.  But if you are looking for a great camera that takes great pictures at a good price, this will absolutely fit the bill.  My only "complaints" are that the battery life is not that great (I just have an extra one always ready to go) and that the one I bought didn't come with a memory card so I had to buy that separately.  But those are minor things for me.Update 4/2/13:  In this short amount of time I love this camera so much and have gotten so many compliments on the pictures it has taken that I just bought one for my sister for her birthday!

Reviews.Title: Not bad for a P&S;
Reviews.Author: Katie
Reviews.Content: The picture quality seems to be very clear when set on Auto mode and once you get used to the different program modes and settings, the pictures are very clear and crisp under almost every type of situation. The buttons and menus are pretty self explanatory and you do not need to watch the dvd to get started. The one problem I have found is that when recording video, if you zoom in and out you can hear it zooming on the video playback. Other than that it's a great little point and shoot to have around.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: J. D. Stevens
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera due to the small size.  I was looking for a camera to take to stand up shows and concerts.  Last night i got to test it our at a stand up comedy show with low lights.  The zoom was great and the pictures turned out great.  With full zoom, auto focus and auto settings, low indoor light, no flash, i could not asked for a better picture, every shot turned out great, good lighting and no blur.  Glad i picked this little camera up, great size, outstanding zoom and great picture quality for the money.

Reviews.Title: Well-built camera
Reviews.Author: Mr. LP
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera from BJs. FYI, at this stage, this model is currently made in Japan. At under $300, I think they will be all made in China when they're in mass-production mode. My first impression on this camera is on its sleek design and trim. I bought the silver version, and am happy with my choice of color. I'm ok with the button lay-out. They are easy to navigate without the need of reading the manual. What I am not fond of is Canon's choice of using microSD card. I feel like the card can be broken at any minute.Now that I have owned this camera for a few day, I brought it out and took a couple pictures outdoor. To get the most of of this camera, users definitely have to get used to its scene modes. For outdoor photos, I think the color is fairly accurate in auto (program) mode. I tried other modes on the same subjects (grass, leaves, flowers...) and enjoyed the special effect the camera delivered. "Soft focus" gave a nice, creamy layer over the photo, while "super vivid" gave the green of leaves and grass a real eye-catching tone. Miniature effect is another fun mode I like...I haven't tried taking the video yet, but with the the build and picture quality, plus the reasonable price tag, this camera is a 5 stars for me currently. Don't overlook this camera if you're in the market for a good-looking, pocketable P&S; for casual shooting.

Reviews.Title: Compact Camera with Big, Big Features
Reviews.Author: W. Saunders
Reviews.Content: My wife was looking for a small camera that she could bring with her easily anywhere she wanted.  This little number was just what she was looking for and then some.  The camera is very small and takes amazing pictures and has a spectacular 12x optical zoom.  It also has great video quality.  I have always had in mind that you use a video camera for video and a still photo camera for still photos.  If you are taking video on a tri-pod and will not be needing to zoom in and out then you don't need to break out your video camera.  This thing makes beautiful video and even has stereo sound.  Loads of other features my wife will probably never use but it's there in case she ever gets adventureous.  For around $100 you can't beat it if you are looking for somthing compact.  Replacement batteries are dirt cheap as well.  The wife loves it and I am jealous.

Reviews.Title: Excellent resolution
Reviews.Author: GB
Reviews.Content: Absolutely perfect color rendition is a welcome surprise. Taking pictures at extended zoom is also surprisingly enjoyable. No excessive noise noted, in comparison to the dozens of point and shoots I've owned. Maybe a previous reviewer got a bad copy of the camera. Highly recommend this delightful Elph, especially because it does NOT have a touch screen!

Reviews.Title: Really portable fun camera
Reviews.Author: Kyle "cylem"
Reviews.Content: So I owned a Lumix LX7 which was an amazing camera, it had an extremely sharp lens, was really quick and took awesome video. Though I found that I really didn't use it's potential and it was really difficult to fit into my pocket and zoom was soso, after CES there are alot of things coming out in the next few months that look good so I decided to sell my LX7 and get something a bit more portable for the time being.A few things that i was look for in a camera-Takes high speed videos-Takes HD video-Decent zoom-decent continuous shooting-Fast AF and overall operation.-PocketableSo the LX7 did most of these with the exception of an iffy zoom and wasn't to pocketable. I saw this little puppy on ebay for a cool $75 and though bang what do I have to lose? Well I found I had alot to gain!Great things that it has that I want:It takes high speed video at 120fps (640x480) and 240fpsh (320x240) though I prefer the LX7's 720p @ 120fps this is doable for the random times I like to have it plus it does 240fps.Takes HD video, 1080p is only at 24fps rather than the 60fps that I was used to but honestly it's not a huge deal and video has zoom and autofocus on this camera which is great! though the AF is quite slow and I can't take photos during the video.This has a 12x zoom which I have no clue how with its size. I think it has somethng to do with the smaller 1/3' sensor thoughAs for speed the continuous shooting is up to like 6fps at 2.5 megapixels which is a far cry from other which do usually a minimum of 10fps at full resolution or up to 60fps though It's usable in the the times you need to use it.However I would like to mention most cameras seem to limit to only like a couple seconds with their burst, and even though this is like 6 fps I sat there for a good 10+ seconds and it never stopped it appears to just keep going and I'm only using a class 4 card. Also as for normal operation speed this thing never slows down, going through menus, AF speed, and looking at video is all very quick.This thing I can't get over how tiny it is, especially with the zoom and features. It is literally the exact same size of my credit cart and slightly thicker than my cellphone. When the lens is out at wide angle it is about a half inch out and at full telephoto it is only like an inch out maybe which is also strangely small!Cons are mostly comparisons I listed above, another one I didn't mention was low light performance is iffy, You really need whatever it is you are looking at the be still, when you do though it looks decent enough. Also like people say it takes micro sd, which isn't great but really not a big deal at all if it means I get a smaller camera.Overall I might think of keeping this, there are a couple cameras coming out soon with some great feature sets but are looking pricey and area  bit larger. I really fell in love with the size and featureset of this and might just end up not being able to leave it!

Reviews.Title: Good Low Light Focus
Reviews.Author: D. Dunlap "Dond13"
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera to replace a 10 year old Canon S1 IS and I was a little disappointed with some of the features.  The one feature I really appreciate is the Low Light Focus of the camera in full zoom.  My S1 was pretty useless at full zoom unless it was bright sunlight, but the ELPH 520ES is excellent.The cons are that it isn't as sharp as I expected.  I have it set to the highest resolution but the photos are not top notch whenshown full screen on my monitor and they are a little weak on my printer.The camera is VERY small and LIGHT and I am having a major problem shooting Video.  I guess I'm just too shakey, but all of my Videos are almost at the point of being annoying to watch with the movement of the camera.  I am an old man though, almost 80, and that just may be my problem.  I believe that a view finder would probably solve most of my problems but alas, there is none.  I have to look at the screen and if I try to zoom in while shooting, it is laughable.  I guess I just need to use a tripod while shooting video, but that would only solve the problem half the time.  When I move, it really gets bad.Overall, I am satisfied with the camera, but I still use my S1 for Video when I am walking because it has a viewfinder.

Reviews.Title: Recharger included in box
Reviews.Author: Claire
Reviews.Content: Frankly, I have not used this camera yet.  I purchased it because of its size, and I am really happy with that. What I really want to mention is that the battery recharger IS included in the box.  It does not mention this anywhere on the technical data and so I additionally ordered a battery charger pack that came with two extra batteries.  This was an unnecessary expense for me.Canon PowerShot ELPH 520 HS 10.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom 28mm Wide-Angle Lens and 1080p Full HD Video Recording (Red)

Reviews.Title: Wanted this as replacement for Elph SD780, but not a big enough improvement.
Reviews.Author: Goldfinch
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a replacement for my old Canon Elph SD780 IS (at least four years old).  I spent an afternoon taking side-by-side shots with the new camera, my old Elph, and my iPhone.The pros:- It takes beautiful pictures if you're going to use them small. Colors/exposure are great - what I've come to expect from Canon.- Interface is great - minimal - excellent ease-of-use.- Big display is nice.The cons:- The pictures are VERY GRAINY at anything but the smallest sizes. In my tests, my old camera had LESS grain on some of the shots, and in low light even my iPhone had less grain.- The squared off edges of the camera made it feel a little bulky, believe it or not. My old Elph was the same size, but the edges were rounded, so for some reason it feels much smaller.The bottom line:- I returned the camera, as it just wasn't enough of an improvement over my 4-year-old Elph. However, if you don't have a 4-year-old Elph, and don't mind the grain in your photos, it's amazing how much technology they pack into this little camera, making it easy to use, and easy to get great color/exposure in your photos.

Reviews.Title: Best camera Ive owned
Reviews.Author: Matthew D Schoenholtz
Reviews.Content: Far from a photographer, every few years I purchase a new point-and-shoot camera. Whether technology has improved that much, or this camera is just amazing, I have never been happier with a camera. On the Auto setting, I can take night shots without any blur, day shots with vibrant color, or even zoom from very far away without the pictures looking pixelated. Good battery life, microSD compatible, excellent camera.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Barbara Rosenfeld
Reviews.Content: Good camera, good price.  I don't take videos much, so I don't know how it does with them. but it is excellent for photos.

Reviews.Title: Camera its good battery isnt
Reviews.Author: Gilberto Heredia Cuellar
Reviews.Content: All the things have this beautiful camera its great just one thing isnt good at any lvl the battery duration... its so poor... 100 pictures and the red battery icon appears.. but all the rest its great.

Reviews.Title: For those complaining about the micro-sd card...
Reviews.Author: Hokie Fan "Hokie Fan"
Reviews.Content: Yes the micro card IS tiny. So is this wonderful camera.  The tiny size is why you want this cameraI put a 16 gb class 10 card (around $20) in and just leave it. When it is time to download I just plug up the USB cable and go. I do the same with my 7d  DSLR. I shot 600 pics and several movies over spring break in Fla and only used half the capacity.  There is no reason to be pulling the card out for downloads.JUST LEAVE THE CARD WITHIN AND ENJOY THE TINY POCKET ELPH.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera BUT.....
Reviews.Author: R. Sutton
Reviews.Content: I purchased my 520HS a couple of weeks ago.The UP side:  I must say the camera can take some very nice pictures and video. Pictures are truly amazing. They look like a professional photographer took them.Well they should, I was a professional photographer.  Now I do it for fun.The DOWN side:  What happened Canon?  Battery life as compared to other Canon Elph units sucks.  After about 4 minutes of video and maybe 30 pictures the low battery icon starts flashing.  First Canon supplies only an 890 mAh battery.  There are many clones out there at 1200 mAh.  Second, Canon (at least on Amazon) does not supply a Micro SD card.  ( A local warehouse operation starting with a C provides the same camera with a case and the card.)Update:  Have used the camera for a few trips now.  Battery life seems to have improved a bit.  Dislike:  This camera comes with no memory card.  (see above recommendation on where to buy) Perhaps they don't want you to know it's a "micro-SD" card that's required.  That's a big dislike for me.  Fist it a pain to get in and out of the camera due to its size and placement.  Using the supplied cord to transfer pictures to the computer is convoluted as well.Update:  July 26, 2013 - If not for the 12 x 1 zoom, I'd dump this camera in favor of one of my older models. Really dislike having to fight to get the sub-miniature mini-SD card in and out of the unit.Upodate:  Camera was given away.  Poor battery life and Micro SD card.

Reviews.Title: Great inexpensive camera
Reviews.Author: Bruce "Bruce"
Reviews.Content: Great pictures and very easy to use.  Image stabilizer is a great option.  Excellent Battery life.  A excellent camera for the  price.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera, missing a few features I'd have liked
Reviews.Author: SFA
Reviews.Content: I may update this review as I learn more about the camera.First of all, let me get the main thing out of the way which I'm sure is so important to the rest of you as it was to me...:)IT"S BLUE! And wow is it ever pretty! This design is sleek, gorgeous and very snazzy.The pictures it takes are almost too clear, I see lines and blemishes even the mirror won't show me in these pics. Am I really that old looking in hd?!!Thank goodness for the blur feature...though I haven't figured that out yet.It's a great little camera, though I found later you can find as good for cheaper, but ah well.

Reviews.Title: perfect camera
Reviews.Author: slammer
Reviews.Content: This camera is perfect especially for on the go. I love it. It takes great video as well as captures fantastic stills. We have bought 3 of them.  One for my husband, one for my daughter and one for my parents. It's the best compact camera. I am a photographer and it's difficult to always take my SLRs with me especially when riding the motorcycle so this little camera fits the bill. I hope they come out in more colors because I will probably buy another one.  I love giving this for a gift. It's perfect.

Reviews.Title: Takes really sharp pictures
Reviews.Author: Musicmaker
Reviews.Content: I am not a professional photographer and I'm not sure I would notice some of the "unbalanced pixel" stuff other reviewers have complained about.  But for me, I got the camera because you can alter the settings manually if you want. However at this point, I've only really taken photos on auto, in all light conditions, and the camera is quite smart! Very happy!

Reviews.Title: Love the Quality of the Pictures
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This was a great value. I love the quality of the photos.The only frustration is slow response in taking pictures when lighting and conditions are not perfect.  The camera takes the shot when it gets good and ready! The other negative is the low battery life. The camera comes with a battery charger but be prepared to charge the battery often.Regardless, the quality of the shots make this a great value.Also of note was the great customer service I was provided as a result of some issues surrounding my transaction: Without going into great detail, I just want to say, Amazon really care about their customers and strive to make them happy.Thanks Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Perfect camera for a novice photographer
Reviews.Author: Andrew Rice
Reviews.Content: This camera excels with its many shooting modes and easy to use interface. It takes fantastic pictures on the auto setting. The battery life is the only thing that is keeping this camera from a 5 star rating in my opinion. It could be a little better I think. As it is, it will still last for a short outing maybe 4-6 hours. My girlfriend and I take a LOT of pictures though. So keep that in mind, I imagine if you are more casual with your picture taking it would last longer. We also used the various shooting modes (Which we love) all the time, and I assume that takes more battery as well. All in all, totally worth the money. I could even justify spending another 80 dollars on it for it to come as it is. I will probably buy a spare battery.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: P. Burns "pat_boy2008"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera to take with me on a trip to New York, and wow what an amazing camera! I takes beautiful pictures. The auto mode is really good for just shooting without having to fumble around with settings. And if you like to fumble with settings (like I do), its got that too. However, I wish there was a way to save your own custom presets so you can switch to it quickly rather than having to re enter all your settings again. The metal body is so beautiful on this device, but be sure not to drop it. I dropped it once (at about 3 feet or less) and bended a corner. And that was with the camera in its case. Be sure to always use the srap and I recommend buying a hard shell case.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot for folks who want a good camera but are less concerned with "cool" ultra hi-tech features.
Reviews.Author: Moxie Harvey
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera a week and I am smitten!  I am not super hi-tech and wanted a simple camera with video that could record my kids doing everyday things.  This is a fantstic point and shoot camera.  I love the shutter speed.  It quickly takes photos so I don't miss those funny faces, etc that kids do quickly but then won't re-do for a picture.It is also very small, sleek but feels durable.  This is my second in the ELPH series.  They really are terrific cameras.  I don't have an iphone or all those fancy gadgets but I find this camera easy to use, very functional and budget friendly.

Reviews.Title: ** Bad for video!! Only read if you are buying for primarily video / vlog / vlogging ***
Reviews.Author: Claire
Reviews.Content: I have to give this product one star.  I feel bad doing this, but if you are like me and only plan on using the camera for video vlogs / vlogging, you will be disappointed.  I bought this camera because its small form factor and the video specifications, on paper, is an improvement compared to the ELPH 330 HS.  On paper, the 520 HS is superior in that it can record 1080p@30fps vs the 330 HS's 720p@30fps.  It is newer than the 330 HS, and its base price is higher.  There are positive reviews all over the web and there are not many negative reviews.  I could not, however, find reviews that specifically target video.  So I went for the 520 and hoped for the best.The camera feels solid, and I cannot knock it for its form factor and its performance when taking photos.  It seems to excel at taking photos, and its slim design makes it easy to carry in your pocket.  At first it seemed awesome as I recorded the first few videos.  I noticed that autofocus was not turned on, and I continued recording after I turned on the autofocus setting.  Once I started to edit the clips, I heard a sound that resembles a mix between a metal click and a plastic click.  It is repetitive and consistent.  At the bottom of this review I will provide a link so you can hear the sound I'm describing.  I first thought that the sound could be coming from the plastic dongle of the wrist strap hitting the side of the camera as I moved around.  It made sense and it would explain the metal / plastic sound I heard.  After removing the strap, however, the sound continued.  I noticed that the microphone is embedded into the metal ring around the lens.  Usually the microphone is under the flash (as in the 330 HS).  This small difference actually makes a rather large impact on the audio quality and makes the 520 HS's microphone super sensitive to any motion of the lens.Once I became aware of the root cause, I searched for any reviews that referenced the same problem.  I found only one review that I would consider a trustworthy source (PC magazine-  [...] )  PC magazine hit the nail on the head and noticed the issue, but since they were mostly focused on photo specs, the problem only received one sentence in their page long review.  Here is what PC magazine says: “The camera can zoom and focus while recording, but the sound of its lens moving in and out is audible on the soundtrack."  I read the PC magazine review prior to purchasing this camera, but the issue did not stand out.  Furthermore, the 330 HS has the same sound issue when focusing, but the *key* difference is that the 330 HS has a faster autofocus mechanism, and on top of that, the microphone is below the flash.  Both of these factors diminish the sound from the lens in the 330 HS.  Since the microphone is literally on top of the lens in the 520 HS, the sound of the lens is amplified rather than filtered out.  It was very disappointing and I can’t believe Canon did not pick up on this during QA.  I don’t understand the benefit of moving the microphone into the lens.Lastly, I am not the only one with this problem.  There are two other popular vloggers that I know of who recently upgraded to the 520 and their initial reviews were positive.  After a few weeks of video, however, they also noticed the problem.  Since they use several different camera models simultaneously, it took longer for them to catch this issue.  During this time, however, I bought the camera.  So if you plan on buying this camera for primarily video work (such as vlogging), DON’T buy this camera!!!  Go with the 330 HS instead.-Michael & ClaireOne of my videos that highlight the issue:  [...] (listen at 3:35 but it happens throughout the video).  I usually hide it with background music, but that only goes so far.

Reviews.Title: Camera broke after a month of use; Canon charges $175 for "in-warranty repair"
Reviews.Author: Bryan Kennedy
Reviews.Content: One day the lens refused to open - simply reporting "lens error" before shutting down. I paid to have the camera sent into their shop for an in-warranty repair (we just bought the camera recently), but they sent back an invoice for $175 plus shipping (to repair a $120 camera!) even though the camera is in warranty.Will not purchase anything from canon ever again.

Reviews.Title: Nice features and overall design, but noise level is just horrible
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: I completely agree with HCedrinks's review. "NOISE. On the camera's built-in screen, everything seemed fine at first sight. But zooming in, I began to notice the extreme amount of noise present in nearly all the pictures."Sadly, my 6-year-old PowerShot SD750 is capturing better images than this camera. I am wondering if I just got a defective camera. I posted some sample cropped noisy images with no down-sampling in size so one can really see the noise.The navigation buttons are a bit too small for my liking, but I guess this is due to the large LCD screen taking up most of the back panel.I found this CNET review which is very much in line with my observations."The Canon PowerShot Elph 520 HS' photo quality is good to very good, but overall disappointing compared with past HS-model Elphs. Even at its lowest ISO settings, subjects look soft and noisy when viewed at 100 percent. Unfortunately, that means the 10-megapixel resolution doesn't give you much room for enlarging and cropping.  At ISO 1600 and 3200, noise and noise reduction destroy fine detail, making things look soft and smeary, and you can see yellow blotching from noise. "

Reviews.Title: Many photos are out of focus, poorly lit
Reviews.Author: TM
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a budget point and shoot to replace my Sony W290 that was stolen :(. This one had lots of good reviews on photo sites, high ratings on amazon. I am just a regular everyday user - i like to take photos of family, home, travel etc. i don't use any special settings or set manual controls for speed etc.I hate this camera!First - The autofocus seems very slow, and often even for still photos, the camera won't shoot a sharp photo on the first take. I have to take several photos to get a good shot. Between shots, the camera is slow too. Second - Indoors, the photos are more frequently out of focus, poorly lit etc. The flash is not even, and there is no flash override where you can force the camera to use flash in some situations, for example, backlighting. There is either auto-flash or no flash. The results are usually better in outdoor light.Third - the battery life is poor. I haven't tracked closely (the specs say 190 shots per charge) but it seems I am recharging all the time.I've had this camera for less than 2 months and the lens cover just malfunctioned (doesn't close completely, doesn't open completely). It's still under warranty but i would rather buy something else!

Reviews.Title: Nice camera except for the memory slot
Reviews.Author: Thaara Devi
Reviews.Content: I got this camera thinking that it has a SD card slot like any other camera. but it has micro sd slot which uses micro sd cards that goes in the mobile phones. so make a not of this if you are buying this camera thinking of using the same SD card you use in other cameras and camcorders.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful
Reviews.Author: Ema Aw
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my mother to replace a broken Canon Powershot A590 that she had gotten a few years ago. I didnt have alot of time to shop since I needed the camera within a week for my brothers birthday. When this camera came I was very pleased with the weight of it. It didnt feel light and cheap and it's not made out of that toy plastic.It takes really really clear photos and the zoom is amazing. I can literally see 2 blocks down the way with this camera.I would not tho. Since I was in a hurry to buy a camera I didnt do much reading so was surprised to find that this camera has a rechargeable battery (which isnt an issue) also it takes only micro sd cards.Overall this is a wonderful camera and I would recommend it. Especially if you have children since it has an amazing stabilizer.

Reviews.Title: Fun camera
Reviews.Author: Andi C Bair
Reviews.Content: The Canon ELPH series constitutes light-weight, fun cameras, available in many colors, and focused on convenience. Let me use my usual disclaimer, in the interest of fairness, and admit that many cameras by reputable makers (and there are many) deliver what they promise. It is more about what camera traits you are looking for. So, I would suggest to anyone looking to buy one to google 'camera trait search' and get the whole picture.The ELPH520 is a fixed lens camera (point and shoot, some would say), with 10.1 resolution (megapixels), and a x12 zoom (up from x10 on the ELPH 330). The sensor size is 1/2.3 inch CMOS-type, which is standard for cameras of its class.If you were to, say, take pictures of friends and family at an outdoor gathering, this camera is what you need. If you get ambitious, there will be stumbling blocks. Here is the camera's trait mix: It does not have a viewfinder, which, again, many in its class don't. The ISO rating, which is the gauge for how well it does in low light, is 3200. That rating is lower than many others, but it is sufficient for most purposes. The video is a Full HD- that is 1980x1080 resolution. It does not have a hot shoe for an external flash option. That is not unexpected for its size and category. The LCD screen is a 461,000 resolution. The camera does not do RAW processing but you would need only if you did not want to be limited by JPEG type storage. The burst rate is a reasonable 2.4 frames persecond- great for quick shots. The weight of the camera is a convenient 155 grams.The main difference between the ELPH series starting 300s is the new Digic 5 processor, and CMOS sensor instead of CCD. The ELPH 110, and 115 had Digic 4.Overall, nice, fun camera. Having been into photography for a while, I do stress though that you do a camera trait search. That will also tell you more about what you want.

Reviews.Title: Just right
Reviews.Author: Utah Jack
Reviews.Content: This camera is only the size of a business card but thicker.  I love it.  It takes great photos.  So far I have only used it on the automatic mode.  I have started reading the operators  manual and can see that it can do a lot more than I knew.One down side to me is that the battery doesn't seem to last as long as I expected and apparently the battery has to be removed to charge.  An easy fix is to get an extra battery  - maybe one with more storage.Another concern some may have is that the micro memory card is so small that it is might be to troublesome to remove and reinsert - at least for some people.  I just plan to use the included cable to download photos.The instructions seemed a little overwhelming to me at first, but when I actually started using the camera I found it to be very intuitive.Over all.  THIS CAMERA IS JUST RIGHT: GREAT FEATURES AND SMALL!

Reviews.Title: Great Point and shoot
Reviews.Author: S. Kimball
Reviews.Content: This is a great point and shoot camera.  Wanted something cheap but sharp to take on a family vacation to Disney.  It was small and compact enough to fit in a very small shoulder bag, but takes very nice, sharp, clear pictures.  Decent quality night/in-motion pictures as well.  Very pleased with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great Product, Great Price
Reviews.Author: blaine s.
Reviews.Content: Needed a small, inexpensive point and shoot camera to take good photos of people and landscapes. The image quality and zoom were far better than expected. For a non-SLR and built in lens, I've not seen a Point and shoot camera of better quality, in this price range and above

Reviews.Title: Sleek and sharp
Reviews.Author: Annie M. Williams "dalia"
Reviews.Content: I love Canon's...its nice and sleek and takes very sharp pictures....couldn't beat the price on Amazon either! Yo can take many different styles of pictures with this camera

Reviews.Title: Nice, pretty camera
Reviews.Author: Monica J.
Reviews.Content: The camera takes great pictures!  I really like the features, but especially the zoom, which is why I bought it.  I can't wait to take it to my next concert!  The red color is very pretty, as well!

Reviews.Title: Praise of Elph 520
Reviews.Author: Vanna L. Schwamb
Reviews.Content: So far, it is a nice upgrade for me.. Good little camera! The increase in zoom is especially good with the flexibility in focus.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 520 HS 10.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom 28mm Wide-Angle Lens and 1080p Fu
Reviews.Author: stephanie posada
Reviews.Content: Most awesome camera i have ever owned. Durable, universal, and clear pictures every time. It is easy to use and the video is awesome

Reviews.Title: Great pocket camera!
Reviews.Author: kvt5
Reviews.Content: I have only had the camera for a short time, but love it so far.  Perfect, small size and really easy to use.  One of my favorite features is the ease of transferring the pictures to my pc.  My first real test is coming soon as I ordered my first photo book with pics from the camera.  But overall, VERY pleased with this purchase!Update: after receiving my photo book I still love it.  The quality of the pictures are amazing!  People who see the book can't believe the pics were taken with just my little point-and-shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Lynn M Neeck
Reviews.Content: I wanted a small camera to bring with me on motorcycle trips. I was able to shoot some amazing pictures while riding out west!  This camera works great for outdoor shots that do not need a flash.  I still have not found a setting I like for indoor photos yet...the flash is not very powerful for distance. I will keep playing around with it until I get the desired results. I love that it uses lithium batteries rather than regular AA batteries. I'm sure once I am familiar with all the features I will rate it a 5 stars!  Definitely recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Canon Power Shot
Reviews.Author: Max
Reviews.Content: It seems to eat the battery quick.  Will have to buy another one.  Easy to use.  Lots of features.  Turns on fast.

Reviews.Title: Memory Card Not Included
Reviews.Author: Samantha E.
Reviews.Content: Great little cameraTakes very nice picturesWhen you compare prices, be aware that this doesn't come with a memory card, which is required for use.

Reviews.Title: Better than ever!
Reviews.Author: Mom2dogs
Reviews.Content: I had a Canon Elph before that I loved but lost in a flood.  For the last 2 years I've been wanting to replace it.  I checked on Amazon and found 1 even better than I had for less money.  The camera is easy to use and takes great pictures.  The 12X optical is amazing!  This camera even takes video and does it well.  It's the same great size but is packed with so much more.  I even checked at the club store that I belong to and they couldn't even come close.  I love this camera so much that I bought a second one for a gift.  The price was amazing, and the service was great.  It arrived exactly when I was told that it would.  Can't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: Takes great pictures for its size
Reviews.Author: Michael F
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a couple of reasons.  First, to take family pictures.  Our old compact camera died after 10 years, so we needed a new one. Second, I'm a commercial real estate broker and sometimes need pictures of properties.  I don't list a lot of properties, but when I do I need to take pictures.  I have used this camera for both purposes over the last month and it has performed really nicely.  The pictures come out very clear, lots of detail. My wife's SLR camera is superior, but for the size and price I'm extremely pleased with this.  If you read the manual before using, everything is easy to figure out.

Reviews.Title: Value for money
Reviews.Author: Manish
Reviews.Content: This camera is very nice at very low price, I bought it for around $120 and it came in an open box. I am happy with the pictures I took with it.Pros: Very small form factor. great optical zoom. Good LCD size. Fast shooting speed.cons: It takes Micro SD card and if you have old SD cards of normal size, you cant use those.Night shots are grainy and does not meet the expectations sometime.

Reviews.Title: Best Zoom!
Reviews.Author: Trish
Reviews.Content: My Canon PowerShot Elf 770 broke (lens wouldn't open) just one week before my India & Nepal trip, so I ordered this one.  It didn't come with a memory card, so that was an additional expense, but the price for the camera was great.  It uses a micro memory card, so none of the other memory cards that I used with my other Elf will work, nor will the batteries, since this one uses rechargeable lithium.  That being said, this is a great little camera.  I took about 1,500 pictures, many of which I used the zoom to the max when taking pictures of birds or animals in Citwan National Park or the Ghats along the Ganges.  They were not grainy or blurry, as with my old Elf.  The stabilizer is amazing!  I even took some great shots while riding in tuk tuks and rickshaws in the crazy India traffic.  Normally, I take my Canon Rebel as well as my Elf, but I wanted to minimize my packing.  I didn't have any regrets.

Reviews.Title: Nice Point n Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: Arnold M. Abate Jr. "amajr316"
Reviews.Content: For starters, I have been looking at a dslr camera for some time.  But, there is, in my world, the need for a simpler, smaller, easy to carry camera.  Enter - this Canon Powershot Elph 520.  It offers impressive zoom, a nice flash, and takes some very nice pictures.  It offers some features like fill 1080 video WITH SOUND, and image stabilization.  Plus, it has a a dedicated video button, so you dont have to turn it off of still camera and turn it on as a video camera - you can do it on the fly.  You can browse the menus and tweak some other settings, but for the average point n shoot user, just charge the battery and go!It fits easily in your pocket (right around 3/4" thick), and starts up pretty quickly.  The only improvement that I would like to see is the ability to shoot continuous images more quickly - maybe there is a menu setting I should look at???  Battery life is good, and all in all, I have no problem recommending this to others.

Reviews.Title: Best of the Lot
Reviews.Author: Michelle M. Ress "safoocat"
Reviews.Content: This is the best of the ELPH 110, 300, & 520. The 520 has the most zoom and the easiest controls. The 300 is also nicebut I'd pass on the 110, the controls are flush and hard to operate. This camera is fun, has a nice square retro look and a good sized battery. Mine has a nice fitting case to protect it. The pictures are just awesome. Michelle Ress June 2013

Reviews.Title: GREAT LITTLE CAMERA
Reviews.Author: TRAVEL48
Reviews.Content: For an upcoming trip to the Canadian Rockies, I wanted a replacement Canon PowerShot ELPH with a better zoom.  This one has a great zoom....takes clear, crisp pictures and fits in my pocket.  This was the perfect choice for my travel snapshot taking!

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: Kathy "kathy"
Reviews.Content: We have used and enjoyed this camera.  I think it is advertised properly and we would recommend it to those looking for an easy to use camera

Reviews.Title: Amazing full-feature camera in a small package!
Reviews.Author: David M. Schlaack
Reviews.Content: I had always been a little intrigued by the Canon ELPH series of cameras but had not purchased one until now.  This 520 HS with the CMOS sensor fills my needs for a little pocket camera that works indoors without a flash.  In most cases I get a very good image by using the program mode,  and allowing a little time for the autofocus to stabilize.  The optical zoom works excellent and integrates easily with the digital zoom to reach way out to grab a distant feature,  although image quality suffers with digital zoom,  as should be expected.  This little box fits easily into my cell phone holster allowing it to be always accessible,  which is often the best feature of a point and shoot camera and the secret to getting many interesting shots!  With the low price and Canon reliability, this is a great bargain and is now my travel companion of choice  Dave S

Reviews.Title: A Nasty Surprise with the Video Feature
Reviews.Author: S. A. Topping
Reviews.Content: I purchased this model to replace an earlier Canon that died.  One of the important uses for me is the video feature.  I have been horrified to discover that the video automatically stops after about 10 minutes when you're shooting in high definition, even though there was plenty of room on my memory chip (purposefully large to accommodate my needs, I thought).  The first time or two it cut out, I thought maybe I'd accidentally touched a button and stopped the recording.  But no, when I searched through the fine print, I discovered this little quirk.  Since I wish to record jazz songs that might last, say, 12 or 15 minutes, this camera is now very disappointing to me and I'm sorry I bought it.

Reviews.Title: Battery Glitch ?
Reviews.Author: R.Czaster
Reviews.Content: Have purchsed this camera a little over a month ago.  I am very pleased with the performance and quality of pictures it takes - nice! The problem I've noticed however that when placing the battery back in the camera once it has been fully-charged (for example), it will not turn on.  I discovered that by taking the battery OUT and putting it back IN about 5-10x times, it suddenly starts to work again.  I suspect it could be a battery contact problem but am not sure? Hopefully this is just a problem with MY camera and not a common problem with this model. I offer this info in the event there are others who may have experienced this same problem.  I am in the process of contacting Canon Support for a replacement/repair as I still think this is a great camera.

Reviews.Title: wonderful
Reviews.Author: THAIVER MARTINEZ
Reviews.Content: Product exceeds expectations. It has a very handy size as it fits up in a pocket of pants. Despite being a low cost camera, presenting the features are incredible. I'm still learning how to handle it but what little I've found but looks like a great camera which I recommend widely

Reviews.Title: Great camera for close up shots!!!
Reviews.Author: Da Foleys "Da Foleys"
Reviews.Content: Great camera!!!  The only negative thing is the manual.  If you are not an expert, its might be hard to understand.  I am a novice but wanted something a little more advanced.  Much smaller than my old camera which is nice to just stick in my pocket.  Does alot more than most point and shoot camera and I am still trying to figure out some of the settings.  I purchased it because it says it takes great close up pictures which is what I will be using it most for.  I ordered a few more batteries for it because other reviews stated that the batteries dont last long but I havent found that to be a problem.  I like having replacements with me just in case.  I dont want to have the perfect picture waiting to be taken and then have the battery die on me.  So far, I love this camera.  Just takes time getting used to something new but so far I AM HAPPY.

Reviews.Title: Great value but get the chip!
Reviews.Author: Dancing Sprit
Reviews.Content: This camera does it all, including image stabilization and movies.  It is light, compact but still easy to use in my big hands.  It is, however, worthless without an installed memory chip, sold separately.

Reviews.Title: A Disappointing Camera
Reviews.Author: GW1947
Reviews.Content: This camera was such a disappointment.  I bought it thinking it was an upgrade of my Canon PowerShot SD1100 Digital ELPH, which was a wonderful little camera.  The SD1100 was so easy to use, the menus were intuitive and easy to navigate. The only reason I replaced it was because I wanted more zoom.  Unfortunately, with the 520, trying to get from one menu to another is incredibly time consuming and frustrating.  The pictures I managed to take were decent, no quarrel with that.  It was just difficult to use.  I would definitely not recommend the Canon PowerShot ELPH 520 to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Glad I Bought It
Reviews.Author: MarkPS
Reviews.Content: I hesitated between a point & shoot & an expensive reflex. I often shoot iin Africa under punishing conditions and have damaged several expensive cameras, so deiced to go with a cheaper, easier verson. Although there are obviously many limitations cmpared to a digital reflex, it has been reliable and so easy to pack & carry around.

Reviews.Title: Overall a good little camera - with a few problems
Reviews.Author: alt
Reviews.Content: I like this camera.  I always take pictures at the maximum size and resolution so I can crop to get the right final product.The Pros:  Lots of shooting modes  Face, wink, smile recognition for timed shots  Face recognition by name  Excellent stabilization even at zoom  Great picture quality  Multiple focus modes  Small size with large display  Good price for all the features and quality pictureCons  No view finder - makes pictures in bright light difficult so see on the screen  Battery life - the battery life seems much shorter then the older elphs I'm used to - not terrible but not great  Micro SD storage - requires the full size adapter to view on most playback devices - just requires carrying more things  Zoom doesn't work in movie mode  No continuous focus in movie mode - set when the button is pushed

Reviews.Title: Smile - You're on Candid Camera!
Reviews.Author: D. T. Harker "Dan"
Reviews.Content: This is my second Powershot Elph.  Plenty high enough megapixels, and a great zoom.  I am a photographer, with very expensive cameras, but use these Powershot Elphs for casual use while out and about.  If you've read any bad reviews about this camera, ignore them.  Their complaints are technical bull.  It takes great pictures and videos.  Get one - snap one up now - especially at this price!

Reviews.Title: Cannon Power shot ELPH 520 HS 10.1 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Robert D. Matthews
Reviews.Content: You have to love all the features of this camera including the zoom lens for those special moments taking pictures or video.

Reviews.Title: Just what I was looking for..
Reviews.Author: Christina Hooper
Reviews.Content: I don't know that much about cameras and was searching for days for a good camera that had 1. a good battery life 2. took nice pictures in the dark 3. did not have disposable batteries 4. looked nice/was a nice size, and this was it!! I went to several stores and was becoming frustrated. I was a bit weary when reading about the battery life for this camera, and read that it was loud, but the battery lasts for a long while and while it is a bit on the noisy side, it doesn't bother anyone. I've had it for a while now and the pictures come out great. I'm very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Rich J.
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera. Takes very clear pictures. The zoom is perfect. Just throw it in your pocket and head out. Great for hikes, walks, the beach or just about anything.

Reviews.Title: Very clear pictures!
Reviews.Author: Tracey
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera because we love Canon and our old ones were feeling a little slow. We have a toddler so you can understand needing to get the shot taken as it happens with no time to wait around for the camera to adjust to the light, focus on certain elements and blah blah, whatever it was our other cameras took 5 seconds to do. This one snaps the picture immediately with great quality and we're so happy with it!

Reviews.Title: Nice camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Lynn M. Fredricksen
Reviews.Content: I loved the Canon ELPH I had before, but dropped it once too many times, so had to get a replacement. This is a nice camera. It has different features, some unnecessary. The one thing it does not do that my previous camera did was take sound recordings. This was a feature I used more than you'd think when wanting to record what was going on without the video (like in church or at a school concert). This has other features that will take a little getting used to, but look like they'll be fun, like the feature that lets you made a mini-movie to summarize the day; every time you turn the camera on it films a tiny video (even if you are taking stills) and at the end of the day puts them all together. Could be fun! Haven't printed any photos yet, but they look good on my laptop screen, nice and sharp. Sometimes the images look grainy on the camera screen, but they look fine on laptop.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera for light use; some irritating design decisions with external buttons, menus
Reviews.Author: K
Reviews.Content: I had been using a Canon Powershot 1200 IS for a long, long time, and while the picture quality was normally pretty good, it had a limited number of sizes/resolutions it could photograph in. I am a light-use camera user (mostly use the camera for vacation pictures and cute pet moments). I wanted a Canon camera that was inexpensive, quick to turn on, could photograph in more resolutions (especially 1:1), and would have a general increase in picture quality over the IS 1200.I've been using this camera for a few months now. General impressions:--Really pleased with the picture quality improvement over the 1200 IS. It does much better in low light, and in general, the colors appear richer.--It is super small, about the size of a deck of cards. The case I was using for the 1200 IS is a little loose on the ELPH 520.--The camera menu navigation buttons on the back of the camera differ from the vast majority of other Canon cameras, and I HATED it at first. There's no external "delete picture" button and I couldn't easily find a delete option in the menus; I actually had to get out the manual and look for instructions in order to find it. This camera takes 4-5 clicks to delete a picture instead of 3 because is does not have an external delete button.--Battery life isn't as good as the 1200 IS. I only use mine in short bursts, but I still noticed that the camera needed recharging sooner than my IS would've at similar rates of use.--Uses a microSD card for storage. I fortunately already owned a USB microSD card reader, but for others, it's not as widely used as SD cards.I am mostly satisfied with this camera. I think that it is a good camera for the money, and I definitely prefer its photo quality to the 1200 IS. But I'm not 100% convinced I got the best possible camera for this price range (especially because of the irritating design issues with the buttons/menus).

Reviews.Title: great price and quality
Reviews.Author: CCHershey "veterinarian and avid bookworm."
Reviews.Content: I have had the ELPH cameras for the past ten years and recently bought this camera for a great deal on amazon for a friend who is having a destination wedding.  I have always been please with the use friendliness of the camera and the quality of pictures,  and will buy this camera again!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: Ron Davis
Reviews.Content: Actually had to return this camera because it would  not focus periodically. (refund only-Boo)  I ordered another from B/H and it works very well.  I would give this camera five stars if it was in a "full-metal jacket".It focuses quickly and most pictures are sharp.  Not sure about the image stabilization but long-range shoots do yield pretty good results for a cheap camera.You want to document on the fly?  This camera will do it. It replaces my old Cannon SD1200IS.  The advances are clear.

Reviews.Title: Forgot how good true digital camera pictures look
Reviews.Author: Reginald Noble "jjg247"
Reviews.Content: Having used iphones for all of our picture-taking, we picked this camera up for a long family trip. The quality is stunning. Video is also exceptional quality.

Reviews.Title: Good camera with powerful zoom and great features.
Reviews.Author: Abhi
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, powerful 12x zoom for a point and shoot camera, great resolution. I took some amazing pictures of bison that were at least 1000 meters  away at Yellowstone. It seemed as though I had taken those snaps from a couple of hundred meters away! I loved this camera. Only reason why I wont give it a 5 star is the color quality of the pictures could be better.

Reviews.Title: good for a small camera
Reviews.Author: Isaac
Reviews.Content: It is compact and has a good zoom, the pictures seem fine, could be sharper, for the sale price we are very happy.

Reviews.Title: Great Snapper!
Reviews.Author: Christopher J Schram
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  Its great on battery life and takes good photos.Great price as well.  I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Soaringshah
Reviews.Content: Clear, crisp photos. Only downside is it requires a MicroSD Card, which can be a pain, but otherwise a solid buy!

Reviews.Title: Quality is equivalent to the price
Reviews.Author: Nancy Zhang
Reviews.Content: Photo quality was below my expectation for a Canon. The camera body itself, however, is stunningly sleek and sharp. If you're looking for a light carry-around camera for snapshots to post on social networking sites, this is the one to get. I highly recommend getting a few backup batteries though, the battery life isn't enough to last even the most conservative camera user.

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: Mahbubul Maruf "nycsmaruf"
Reviews.Content: tiny, great picture quality. if you are lazy like me and don't want to carry a big camera, and always make your wife carry your camera, this camera will fit in the shirt pocket and u won't even know about it. PICTURE QUALITY IS AWSOME. I can always vouch for cannon. i can buy a 5 megapixel in a cannon camera and know that its better than 12 mp in a nikon or any other camera which are similar to the cameraat least 100 dollars more in the market. BUY IT. AND YOU WILL BE HAPPY.

Reviews.Title: Little Red Camera!
Reviews.Author: Alice L. Oksuz
Reviews.Content: Good camera!  I didn't expect much from this point and shoot.  It took better than expected night shots.  Without flash, if your hands are steady enough, it takes good shots.  Of course it won't be crystal clear, but it was good enough for the effect I was aiming.  Camera is great for day shots and video.

Reviews.Title: Easy to Use Compact Camera
Reviews.Author: deltad
Reviews.Content: Nice little compact camera. Simple instructions. Powers up quick and the pictures are crisp and clear.  Great for travel !

Reviews.Title: Works great with tremors
Reviews.Author: A. kidd "lee k"
Reviews.Content: I'm handicapped and need a camera that can handle severe tremors. There's lots recommended but they start at 250 bucks used. I got this with extra batteries and a case for 135 dollars. Both Video and still shots have no zero zilch blurring from my tremors! And its not too heavy so I can hold the weight of the camera away from my body and still take sharp photos tho' I am shaking. Tho' the menu is better than a previous Canon I had, I still can't find things like review photos or zoom so I'll hafta read the manual-which I have not done yet. Lastly You need to get a microSD card for it-it does not take sd cards so If you use a Samsung Chomebook to see whats on the card, it will not work unless you use a special Chrome cloud based reformat program on the micro sd card which I do not recommend.

Reviews.Title: Good price, fast delivery
Reviews.Author: Clif
Reviews.Content: Picked out this model camera from the Canon website to match some we already use that have been excellent.  This PowerShot ELPH 520 HS appears to be just as good, if not better.  We've had outstanding results with our Canon cameras.  Simple and effective for documenting communications installation by field technicians.  The only problem with this new camera is that it wasn't obvious from the info that it required a MicroSD memory card rather than an SD card.  So I ordered the wrong cards and then had to turn around and re-order MicroSD cards.  Otherwise, service from Amazon and this vendor was flawless.

Reviews.Title: Just received new camera
Reviews.Author: Horse Gal
Reviews.Content: I accidentally broke my FujiFilm camera and was hesitant to replace it because I loved its features.  Well, this little camera is amazing!  I have only taken about 20 pictures so far, but quality is fantastic.  There is a dedicated video button which I really wanted in a camera.  Still not sure if you can snap a photo while video is going like my old camera, but all in all it is a good replacement.  Buttons are pretty easy to navigate and I love the large LCD screen.  I highly recommend keeping the wrist strap on at all times when using a camera this tiny. It is very easy for it to slip out of your hands.

Reviews.Title: Love it! Love it!
Reviews.Author: Debbie Schultz
Reviews.Content: Great compact size with all the features I wanted.  Amazing zoom capabilities and the stabilizer makes every picture a clear one.  Very simple to use for most features. However, it is a little confusing to figure out what all the button functions are without actually looking at the manual. I also love the beautiful blue color - I always know which camera is mine.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: murk
Reviews.Content: Great product! I love it, and it works just as advertised. I would recommend it to anyone, even if I didn't know them.

Reviews.Title: nice little cam with great specs
Reviews.Author: Darius KOESTER
Reviews.Content: I like the format of this camera.the objective is powerful considering the compact and light design. also the functions are easy to handle and you can quickly start taking pictures.the screen is bright and crisp.

Reviews.Title: I am not a professional photographer.
Reviews.Author: garymahabir
Reviews.Content: Great size.fits in my jean pocket easy.Takes great pictures at night.I have used only one setting (auto) and intakes good pictureAwesome zoom

Reviews.Title: Top of the line in digital cameras
Reviews.Author: DJdenid
Reviews.Content: This is my second ELPH, the 1st I purchased in 2008. I usea digital camera for work and have tried other brands Canonis by far one of  the "best" in the market. Elph takes crystalclear images...awesome editing features, great price for sucha professional tool... compact, easy to learn (read the book)love it.

Reviews.Title: Worth Money Spent
Reviews.Author: jateen
Reviews.Content: Was a little skeptical since I have never owned a canon but this little guy packs a big punch. Picture quality is amazing. I like how the image does not get distorted when you zoom like my Kodak and Olympus. Battery life is decent and so far I have no complaints with this camera. Very pleased with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Theresa J. Boucher
Reviews.Content: So far I am quite happy with this camera. I just wanted a small point and shoot that was priced reasonably and this fit the bill. Easy to use, and I'm happy with the quality of the photos.

Reviews.Title: Excellant camera
Reviews.Author: weave
Reviews.Content: The Canon PowerShot Elph has proven to be all that it was advertised to be.  The pictures are excellent, the high def video looks great on my high def TV on playback.  The only down side is the battery life.  I have just ordered a second battery to be able to have one ready for when I need it.  I am very happy with the quality of the pictures and videos that I can take.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Epic
Reviews.Content: I love this camera so far. It is very easy to use for someone who doesn't know a lot about cameras like myself. The zoom is incredible. For the price and the quality of the pictures, I would definitely recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great lil camera!
Reviews.Author: Janet Spain "Jan Spain"
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for all that it promises to do....its size, shape, weight, and zoom are perfect for me. It is not meant to be anything but a compact camwra that can take amazing photos and fit in your back pocket. It delivers.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't ask for better
Reviews.Author: Fish
Reviews.Content: For the price it was what an inexperienced photographer could ask for. The auto focus is great.  The zoom is great also

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: JJ
Reviews.Content: Works great! Love the long range lens and low light capability.  Small size makes convenient to take everywhere.  Good little camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice Digital Camera!
Reviews.Author: Williams Jean "Willo jean"
Reviews.Content: OK i ordered this Digital Camera for 40% of the work i do, this Digital Camera works great and the picture quality is 10 (MEGAPIXELS) and i have got to say that this camera takes Cristal clear pictures!!, overall this camera is small with a big bright screen and very nice looking, the video quality  is great at 1080p, the only down side of this camera is that the battery dies fast(30min) , this problem can be easily fixed  by getting a better battery for it, Amazon sells those battery for a great price, any ways great camera , it gets the job done.

Reviews.Title: Such great pictures for a GREAT price!
Reviews.Author: lovecustomerservice
Reviews.Content: After my brother bought this camera on a cruise and took fantastic shots- I watched it on Amazon for months!  I bought it right before a trip to DC.  It is a great size for travel and has a screen to take and review photos.  The only thing I don't care for is the tiny memory card.  I feel like I could lose track of it quickly.  I don't know much about camera settings so use "auto" and have captured great shots.  It also videos.  You really can't beat the price- I know I said that already but I am extremely pleased with this camera so far.

Reviews.Title: Canon gets it right at right price point
Reviews.Author: agehner
Reviews.Content: I've been wanting a camera that can give me high quality prints. This does. I been looking for a camera that transitions quickly between one shot and the next. This does. I'm still learning to use all of the features, but at this point it does everything I need as well as being compact and lightweight.

Reviews.Title: Well worth the Money!
Reviews.Author: Michael R. Callison
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this little Canon! Easy to use and has excellent picture quality! My other cameras are the Nikon D7000 and Canon SX250. I find myself throwing the ELPH in my pocket a lot! I Love it!!

Reviews.Title: Great Family camera
Reviews.Author: Lauren
Reviews.Content: Great shots of kids and pets. Love all the features and options. You can get crazy with settings or just switch to auto and still get awesome shots.

Reviews.Title: Form Over Function
Reviews.Author: steel5blue "amazonian"
Reviews.Content: This is a beautifully designed, slightly retro looking camera with a metal body and precise mechanics. After using it for a couple of weeks, I had to agree w/ some of the pro reviewers: it looks much better than it performs.
